website_summaries.verdict: A beautiful little tent that is very easy to set up and is perfect for campers who do not want to be awakened at the crack of dawn.
pros: This tent is dark inside which will allow you to sleep longer in the morning
It can fit a queen mattress and a lot of gear
The extra screen room feature gives you a place to hang out and enjoy bug-free camping
A very private tent made with dark material
cons: The back window does not have a roll-up cover
You must use the rain fly

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent to a camping festival (Nocturnal Wonderland) and it's now my favorite tent ever. I was skeptical about it being darker inside than others but my tent was cooler and darker inside than any other at the campground. I slept till 10am or even till noon one day while other campers struggled to sleep past 8-9am because their tents were too warm or bright that early. Everyone wanted to hang out at my tent and everyone kept asking where I got it. I set it up easily by myself in about 15 min, maybe less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding tent.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic blackout tent. Really, really cool private tent. The only thing is I wish they included longer stakes. I will purchase 12inch stakes myself for the future. The foyer feature is cool too because you can keep coolers in relative shade without putting them *in* your tent. *A little tip if you're camping at the beach ... I used a new litter box pan placed at the tent opening with fresh water to dip my feet in before going in to keep sand out of my tent and it worked really well. It's a good hack.
customer_reviews.author: Tuffy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this tent
customer_reviews.text: We just got it today (wow Sunday delivery which i was not expecting) and put it up to make sure it worked. We are just so pleased and excited to use it when we go on our first camping trip which will be in June. It is so nice and dark inside compared to other tents.. I am not a sun lover, so this tent will work out for me. Update : we ended up using it for memorial weekend and here are some photos still love the tent
customer_reviews.author: violalee

customer_reviews.title: Spacious Vacation Home for Young Couple
customer_reviews.text: Spacious one bedroom with an open air concept foyer providing a perfect space to watch the scenery. Plenty of windows that keep the space well ventilated. Great vacation home for young couples looking for affordable style. The blackout curtain keeps the sunlight out for when your nights run late and your mornings even later! (No, but seriously, I love this tent! It's easy to put up, looks good, and sleeps well!)
customer_reviews.author: Ness F

customer_reviews.title: Screened area was great for shoes
customer_reviews.text: Just used this tent for the first time during a cubscout campout. Just me and my 5 year old son. I was able to get it together alone and take it down alone. Screened area was great for shoes! I bought the Coleman Tent Kit to go with it and that was a great idea. It came with better tent steaks. The ones that come with the tent are short and very smooth. Only used them for the front of the screened area and had to put them in a few times before they would stay.
customer_reviews.author: Cacey Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! Needs rainfly attached for full dark effect on rear.
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this tent, it was very easy to setup and pack up the first time, even without looking at the instructions. It come with cheap stakes like all tents do so be sure to get better ones if camping in hard or Rocky terrain. The vestibule is a great size and was great at keeping our sleeping area nice and clean. My only gripe is the rear window has no zip up covering so you HAVE to use the rain fly if you want to achieve the black out effect it advertises.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy B

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy tent, dark interior keeps cool and screened front section comes in handy for dirty boots and a sleeping dog. Tent fits two full sized sleeping bags on a blow up mattress with a little extra room. Downside is the back screened window does not have a zipper cover and is only covered when using the rain fly. Used in rain and it kept warm and dry inside tent but screened section did pool a bit of water in it which had to be dumped/dried before packing up. Nice comfortable and affordable tent, perfect for a couple with small kids.
customer_reviews.author: Rachu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for warm weather camping, really keeps the sun out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this type meaning to buy the Fastpitch version, but that’s on me clearly I don’t read descriptions all the way. My friend has a Fastpitch six person tent and I really liked it because when you’re camping and hung over feeling like you’ve been mauled by a bear when the sunlight hits your just barely fell asleep eyes, you will be wishing you had this tent. Please do keep in mind though this is really keeps the light out so if you’re going camping during cold temperatures make sure you put extra underwear on and extra blankets
customer_reviews.author: MALLORY NONEYA

customer_reviews.title: Very good tent.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 6 person tent, it's very good but Make sure to buy seam sealant! Tent leaks in the seam. But overall you can definitely fit a queen bed inside not sure if two queen bed can fit inside so definitely not. You can stand up fully in the center if you are 5'8" or 9". And you can fit two or even 3 chairs in the front screen room.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping with a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be quality. I've used this on two trips and have been pleased. The darkening is effective and is a huge help with a one year old. I was very pleased at how thick the bottom of the tent was and that the flooring comes up a few inches from the bottom. We were able to fit a queen size mattress, a pack and play, a rocker, and bags with some room to spare. The only thing I don't love is that there is no option to extend the rain-fly over the vestibule, but I knew that when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: East to set up, durable, resistant to wind.
customer_reviews.text: This is a 5 Star tent. Easy to set up, extremely affordable, fits a queen air up plus our two 60 pound dogs and a few bags. The dark room definitely seemed to help but it was also lighter in some places. We used it several times and it did great even in the rain. The screen porch is only screened so rain will get in there but it does help keep bugs and dirt out. Limited storage in the tent but it’s a small $100 tent, it’s absolutely sufficient. For actually being small and only $100 it does a absolute great job at getting my family through the holiday weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley B.

customer_reviews.title: Fine tent, but not dark
customer_reviews.text: Not dark at all. After trying it, I'm surprised at the mixed reviews and the fact that some people found the blackout fabric effective. It wasn't, at all. And the zippers and bottom foot of the tent didn't have any blackout fabric on them anyway. We took this camping with kids hoping they'd sleep in a little, but we were greeted with the sun bright and early, even in the wooded area where we set up. Going to look into an RV or canvas army surplus. Did set up easy and looked cool. And size was more generous for 2 adults, a kid, and a porta-crib. We could have brought the dog too. :)
customer_reviews.author: Clarichatts

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with the quality of the tent
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited when the tent arrived. I like the screened in porch area, before you enter the main portion of the tent, as well as the room darkening shades, which worked very well. These are the good points, however, after several uses the seams started separating and in the corner where the wall meets the floor, it actually tore. I immediately contacted Amazon, which provided a full refund. 5 stars to Amazon, for its excellent customer service. Overall, I was very disappointed with the tent.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Bang for Buck
customer_reviews.text: If all you are looking for is a quick tent that may not last that long...this is a good price for something temporary. I am sending mine back after one use due to water leaking in during an overnight rain fest. We did not experience any crazy weather...just rain. This was the 2nd tent I purchased. The 1st one was the 6 person version. When I set it up I found it huge and was regretting my purchase. Upon dismantling (unused) the cord in one of the poles broke. It's a decent tent if you're willing to patch items as needed. Maybe for the price I shouldn't have expected more.
customer_reviews.author: D Ott

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, fast pitch... for two people
customer_reviews.text: For one person, it takes about 30 minutes. Great light blackout, tons of room, nice screen vestibule. There was also a good amount of wind at night, and the tent didn't budge. Nicely sturdy. The downside, was i bought it "like new". The stakes were bent and rusted. The poles were all rusted. The tent itself was in great condition. Made no sense. Overall, I really like the tent so I'm not returning it, but I've swapped out all the stakes and I'm preparing for the poles to fail. Final note to self... NEVER buy Amazon "like new" products.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for beginners
customer_reviews.text: For reference, I am a camping novice and am speaking from a pleasure campers viewpoint. Why haven't they perfected the way these tents fold up and fit back into the carrying bag? This is a good tent and it was not too terribly hard to set up but the most frustrating part, by far, is trying to fit everything back into the bag. I liked that it had a little area in the front for shoes before entering the main part of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great for first time camping experience
customer_reviews.text: The tent was perfect for the late-sleeper that I am. The sun shone brightly that morning but I still slept until 10:30 am. Otherwise, there were some slight imperfections in the fabric only noticeable from inside the tent. However, on the outside it looked fine and the fabric was intact. Though I didn't have an opportunity to test to see if the tent was still waterproof. Also, the cable inside one of the poles snapped. I didn't bother returning it because it looked like something that easily be fixed...we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Char

customer_reviews.title: No response for weeks on warranty claim, terrible replacement parts catalog
customer_reviews.text: Rain fly broke off the seam on the first night while I was asleep. Filed a warranty claim and been waiting weeks now for even one reply to my claim. Past return period now and they force you to defame the product in permanent marker, so returning it wouldn’t even be an option at this point. Disgusting lack of customer service. Tried to find the replacement part on their site but it’s cryptic, no pictures, and there’s no parts numbers in the manual. I’m stuck with a broken tent and no recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Ready to setup, easy to breakdown. Like most tents in this price range, the tent stakes aren't that great. Knowing this, I bought the Coleman tent accessory kit with better tent stakes, a mallet, and dustpan/brush. We had a steady rain for about 6 hours one night and never had any kind of leaks inside. The light blocking feature is what drew me to this tent since I wake up with any kind of daylight and I was very pleased with how it performed.
customer_reviews.author: Scot Yeanish

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: We broke this out this weekend and loved it. I appreciate being able to stand upright in the middle of the tent. I do wish the directions were detached from the bad and included specific directions for the rain fly. That was confusing. Very roomy. We fit two twin air mattresses, a chair, a bucket toilet and a few 6qt storage boxes with room to move around. The party is nice to storing things that don’t need to be in the sleeping area. Can’t wait to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: zakah123

customer_reviews.title: Took too long to arrive and box arrived smashed and torn!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this tent. Loved the dark room, UV filtering and screen room (except no cover for rain) but I bought a small tarp to cover the screen room. It just took too long (a week) which by Amazon Prime standards and a last minute decision to camp just wasn't going to work. The Eureka Copper Canyon LX 4 person arrived in three days while it had NO directions and was not easy to assemble I still loved it once it was up and wasn't turning back. Also, the box arrived smashed and torn.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Tarp has hole(no option to leave feedback to seller)
customer_reviews.text: My tent tarp had a small hole in it. What is worse it rained really hard the first night we used it and my wife claims she felt rain on her face. Ideally I would just like the tarp replaced but I will have to return the whole thing if I do not hear back from the seller. Unfortunately unlike other orders there is no option for me to leave feedback for this seller to have this resolved. It is a shame because I do believe it is a good ten otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cumings

customer_reviews.title: The pin that holds the pole in place broke the first time I set it  up.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I didn't test the tent prior to going camping. As soon as I set it up, the strap that holds the ring/pin onto the corner of the tent ripped off. Looking at the stitching, there was hardly anything there to secure it in the first place. I was able to secure pole at the corner with some rocks but the fact that this broke the first night is inexcusable.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in wind but lets sand in through vent
customer_reviews.text: We got caught in a Wyoming wind storm for 4 days. The tent held up great and never collapsed, but sand and dirt was blowing in like crazy under the top cover. There is no way to actually enclose the big vent at the top. Dirt can get under the cover with high winds. Everything was covered in dirt and sand at the end of the storm. We had to buy a tarp to put over the vent since the cover didnt keep dirt out. Overall it is a really nice tent minus that flaw. Our dog loved sleeping on the porch.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea - Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: Well, the tent lasted 3 trips to the wind and rain of beach camping. The tent could NOTstand up to 20 mph wind and rain with gusts to 30-40 mph over about a 6 hour period. The fiberglass pools were splintered in multiple locations and water leaked into the tent for hours overnight making for wet sleeping bags and clothes. I really did like the dark room tech as it helped us sleep in past sunrise which was awesome. The Coleman weathertec is a JOKE!
customer_reviews.author: Grad

customer_reviews.title: It really keeps the lights out
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best tent I have used so far. I camped in the Florida Keys this weekend and it was perfect. The really dark featured allowed me even catch a nap in the day and it was really cozy. Perfect for a full size air mattress and lots of room for gears. Easy entrance and exit. I would definitely recommend for 2 persons, would be tight for four. It didn’t rain so I can’t comment on whether it was weatherproof or not but I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the tent I set it up in the yard to make sure I could, it was easy and took about 15 minutes by myself and I've only camped once before. Just used it camping this weekend and we did have rain in the afternoon as well as overnight and the tent stayed 100% dry. I loved the dark feature of it, it really makes a difference, looking into my tent vs my friends mine was pretty dark, 100% dark-no that is impossible and not supposed to be 100% dark but there is a noticeable difference between tents without it vs with it. Well worth $72.
customer_reviews.author: Beth L.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Rainfly tore at the seam on the first used. So I exchanged for another thinking it might be a one time issue. The second one tore at a seam in tent near the door. I returned that one and will not be purchasing another. The darkroom technology is awesome for sleeping in, but it's worthless if the tent is otherwise crap. Very cheap craftsmanship. Hope to find a nice tent at REI that will be dark. For the record, this is not my first tent. I have owned many and currently own 2 nice ones that suite their purpose. I bought this tent strictly for the darkroom technology, but it isn't worth anything.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: We loved this tent! The shade room was such a cool feature especially with our 1 year old! We would let her play with her toys out there and she was nice and shaded. It was pretty easy to set up with 2 people. And we had plenty of room inside the tent even with a queen size air mattress. I would def recommend this tent and I am excited to use it in the future for more camping trips! Note: the shade room part did have small openings on the sides we just stuck towels to block anything from getting in. I think there mist be a reason for that design just not sure what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Lytle Mama

customer_reviews.title: Ill
customer_reviews.text: I actually love this tent for the most part. The darkroom is amazing and really makes a huge difference. In blazing sun it really does stay cooler and is dark enough to nap all day. The major problem is the really big rear window has no flap to close and when we were camping In the outer banks sand incessantly blew in. I finally was able to rig up a flap that sort of worked but it really needs something you can zip up and seal. Other than that it's awesome! Stays dry during torrential Tennessee downpours and stayed tight in high winds while beach camping. Keep making the darkroom style Coleman
customer_reviews.author: BigOwlien

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! I fit a cot and Double size, extra tall air mattress inside with room to spare! I brought it to baja and it did really well staked down in the wind. My buddies tent was getting blown over basically. It was nice to be able to put my shoes, and other gear inside the net area without being inside the actual tent. I also really liked that there were 2 pockets inside so my other buddy and I each had our own place to put our phones and flashlights. Coleman has some quality stuff and this tent is no exception!
customer_reviews.author: SheepdogShaun

customer_reviews.title: nice tent for dry weather only. not for even light rain
customer_reviews.text: assemble was easier than I expected. It took me 20min to assemble. dark room feature is really nice and works. I own 2 more coleman tents but this is different level of darkness. even at noon, inside tent is pretty dark. only complain is weather proof. rain on first night and water started to dripping from electric cord access on the corner. I had to use 2 towel over night. not sure its design issue or defected tent but I see lot a review with water dripping from same place. really nice tent for 2 person even it said 4 person execpt weather proof function.
customer_reviews.author: sean s

customer_reviews.title: had to sleep in my truck.
customer_reviews.text: took this tent on a 4 day camping trip, the forecast was light chance of rain. As soon as the rain touched the tent the water started visibly pouring into the ten, every spot that wasn't covered by the rain fly instantly leaked and flooded tent. As a result the camping trip was spent sleeping in my truck. P.s. the tent was set up on a heavy 5mil tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Steven m.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: First time we used it, it rained. There is a tarp like base to it which comes up on the sides, so it keeps rain from seeping in. I wish the additional space in the front, had a cover on it. You cannot keep anything in the front entry way space, if it’s going to rain. Also, the windows on the sides are too nigh up for viewing when laying down. Wish they were a little lower. Otherwise, for the money, it was a nice tent!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Block most of the light (85%)
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat easy to assemble! But you're also reading a review of a girl who isn't about that camping life. It definitely went ALOT faster than a regular tent! Space... could fit 4 people comfortably IF you use just sleeping bags... air mattress will take a lot of room and make it hard to maneuver around in but me and my boyfriend slept in it with our Queen air mattress and it was amazing ALSO for sure weatherproof because it rained alot and it stayed dry the whole time!
customer_reviews.author: Natosha Bejarano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: This tent survived the Rock Fest 2019 storm suffering only minor damage to one section of one pole. My only suggestion would be to Scotch Guard the seams very well if you're planning on getting rained on. The seams did seep slightly in heavy, constant rain. All in all, a very good tent. I do wish they would have the blackout material on the ENTIRE bottom half of the tent. The material works but it's only on the window flaps so, not getting the most out of the technology.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t live up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: Not so great, good intentions with cost savings shortcuts is my only guess. Bottom line, the leak proof seams “leak” if the smallest anything hits rain top it’s ripped, (see picture) the entrance is not weather resistant whatsoever and poor design. The zippers get filled with grit and won’t work. You have to step on it to open bc it’s missing a stake point? Really dumb design! It should be called sprinkle tech not weather tech. My only recommendation is dry perfect weather camping only. Another reviewer spoke of bugs/insects and it’s no joke hundreds flock to it. Like it’s a beacon. Haven’t seen this before in my lifetime. Overall disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Allred

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great tent. Easy setup, as expected. The screen "porch" is awesome for leaving dirty shoes and other things without having to worry about them being rained on or bugs crawling in. Use it for festivals for 2 people. Fits us very comfortably and was also able to keep our bags and stuff inside as well. Would highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An okay tent with a few minor issues.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I'm quiet disappointed by this tent. First use out of the packaging and the shock cord breaks. No biggie so I pulled a new one through. Upon removal of the pole clips that hold the tent up to the poles two of them broke. I still love this tent and will repair before our next trip but this was a let down. Other then those two minor issues the tent is great and i look forward to using it again. Made it through two weekends with heavy sudden rain storms and no drips.
customer_reviews.author: Estoytaco

customer_reviews.title: Glorified screen tent
customer_reviews.text: Good tent if you only intend to use it when it's hot. Basically a screen tent with a rain fly. Used it in northern MN over Memorial weekend and everyone froze inside, the wind comes right through. I've had another 6-man Coleman tent for about 20 years that I've used all year round and never had to worry about being cold in, just figured it was time for a new one. My old one wasn't 90% screen and had covers you could zip up over the windows. The blackout fly is nice for sleeping in in the morning and the tub floor always keeps things dry...why I wanted another Coleman tent!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan D. Rinerson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely amazing. The first day we went camping we had 45 mile an hour winds and the tent could literally flatten and pop right back up. I love the color and the blackout is very helpful in the morning when the sun tries to ruin the deep slumber. It doesn't have the best ventilation due to the cover on top being necessary to prevent rain and sun but that's fine if you get a fan. My favorite tent I have every owned and very worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsea

customer_reviews.title: Nice purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent. Dark enough to sleep past first light. Easy enough for 1 person to actually set up on their own. I'm 5'4" and can only stand up directly in the middle, but have several inches still available. Nice vestibule, but the vestibule is not water tight, which is nice for a transition space that's not water tight. Overall a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: great lizardo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my tent for about a week and I was loving it. It was easy to set up and the "awnings" allowed me to keep the window open during a light rain. Well, all of that changed last night when it started raining harder and I woke up to water in my tent. I bought this tent because I've never had problems with the Coleman brand but now I'm very disappointed. There was water dripping in all 4 corners of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Wow great tent.  Buy it through amazon about $200 cheaper than at  Bass Pro shops.
customer_reviews.text: mistake we made was putting vinyl blow up air mattress on the tent floor which absorbed moisture somehow and sucked it up through the top of the air mattress which was velour material and then there was moisture between the sheet and the air mattress. You would be perfectly fine if you put your sleeping bag or air mattress on a folding bed etc.
customer_reviews.author: CarolCampbell

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with English directions.
customer_reviews.text: Great summer tent. I took it camping on the 4th of July at the Grand Canyon. This was my first time ever setting up a tent and it was pretty straight forward, but the directions that I had were in Spanish so it made it a little difficult. The tent had plenty of ventilation, so much that it got pretty cold at night. I was able to fit a queen size blow up mattress in the 6 person tent with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Coleman quality wins again!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the darker finish to sleep in a little longer with plenty of visibility outside. I was able to fir two twin beds with room for a couple more; turned out bigger than I thought. The porch was a hit and loved been able to have a landing to place cooler and chairs, and also a place to take off shoes before entering tent. Great quality build typical of Coleman products!
customer_reviews.author: J. del Pino

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I give this a 4/5 stars because everything is spectacular except for two things.. First thing the door to the tent it’s self (not the screen door) his a lip at the bottom that I’ve tripped over 6 times already! 🤣 Lol. Maybe I’m just clumsy but it’d be cool if there was less of a lip there. Second thing is the instructions! While it was easily put together in 15 minutes the instructions were only pictures and they informed you minimally. Otherwise it’s super nice!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylie

customer_reviews.title: Easy one person assembly
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble. It says two people but can be done just one person. Put up and taken down under five minutes. One of the body poles cracked within the first month. We put it up a few times just for the kiddo to play in the backyard. Coleman sent a replacement very fast. It will sleep two adults and two kids (under 8).
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: does not keep out biting gnats.
customer_reviews.text: we took our new tent to Moan this June. the time of year they have tiny gnats that bite like mosquitoes. they suck. we set up this tent for some relief and were very dissapointed to see these little guys squeeze right through the insect netting on the tent. it was a bummer. What is the point of "no-see-um mesh " if the bugs get in?
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to over sleep...
customer_reviews.text: The family loves this tent. Incredibly easy to set up. The short one shot pole sleeves make it simple to not snag the poles. The vestibule is great for keeping the bugs out. The best part of this tent is the blackout feature. No more sun popping out at 0559 to wake you up. The only issue is I keep sleeping in, and not starting the day as early as I would want. Great tent, great price...
customer_reviews.author: Markus Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for two
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for two people. We also had our dogs in there with us so there was some room for the dogs and their beds. The only complaint I have is that the back flap on the window has no way of staying open. There needs to be a tie or clip or something back there. Without that window flap open, you would suffocate!
customer_reviews.author: Andilynn17

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: For a relatively cheap tent I have been impressed by how well this tent has served me. I have a single person Kelty, and a two person Marmot but wanted something larger for car camping with my wife and dogs without spending too much; this tent was perfect. The "darkroom" technology definitely keeps it significantly darker in the tent and also helps keep it a bit cooler. Easy set-up and tear-down, quality materials, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing!!! First time I used it we had 2 huge storms in 24 hours. The tent held up beautifully! Everything inside was dry. Only had a little water in 1 corner. (And by Little I mean about a tablespoon). And you can see the amount of water we got in the picture. Also, the tent functioned well for entry and exit. All zippers worked easily. The large vents in the top and the dark room technology really helped to keep it cooler inside than I expected. Excellent tent for the money!
customer_reviews.author: LHarr4u

customer_reviews.title: Love the dark technology
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Purchased for my son who loves to be in the dark. We had one episode on our first use where the wind lifted it and blew it over (with a 16" fully inflated air mattress inside and bag of clothes), however we were experiencing high winds at the time. No damage was done to the tent.
customer_reviews.author: AwanaMom

customer_reviews.title: Leaks in all four corners
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tent three times, on the third one it was raining heavily and the tent leaked in all four corners. My old 10 year old cooleman still doesn't leak. Cooleman quality is becoming poor.
customer_reviews.author: Tomasz Kasperek

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. My wife likes sunny campsites but I hate the heat. This definitely kept us cool during the day and night. Easy to assemble and survived a 20 minute monsoon lol
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah J.

customer_reviews.title: Was a great tent
customer_reviews.text: Only used it 1 time. However, it did rain during this trip. Everything stayed dry with no leaks. I was very nervous based off other reviews saying it leaks. Went together very easily just like almost any other tent this style. Blocked the sun and kept it dark inside. Very pleased so far. Will update the review if i use it again and it leaks. Would recommed
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Moulding

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Tent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent! I was concerned that I wouldn't be able to set it up by myself (solo, female camper) but I did it with zero problems! Obviously, it would be easier with 2 people but I was able to fully set it up in under 20 mins on my first try! Nice design. Looks very cool. Good amount of space. I like the bonus porch room, great for storage and a nice place for my Chihuahua to hang out. It really does stay quite dark, which is nice. Overall, I'm very satisfied with my purchase. I did lots of research before settling on this tent and I'm glad I decided on this one!
customer_reviews.author: angela ashbaugh

customer_reviews.title: decent tent, NOT a total blackout
customer_reviews.text: the 6 man tent is in reality a small 2 man tent we bought 2 coleman cots and they barely fit they touch the tent sidewalls at the foot & head (bad deal if it rains) and there was only room under the cots for storage , maybe a foot of empty space by the door. it’s NOT a blackout tent but is considerably dimmer inside than normal tents
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Mis-Shipped parts
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you take out the tent and actually put everything together before you take it. The poles included in our set did not match and we could not use our tent and had to sleep in the car. Make sure all the parts actually belong to the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Betty B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent for 3 days to a music festival. It dumped rain the first day and night then sporadic showers between sun and heat after that. I did not get a single drop of even condensation inside the tent. It stayed cooler even when the sun was out and blocked quite a bit of the sunlight. I did seam seal it with Coleman's seam sealant prior to use. I'm so glad I decided to splurge a little on this gym well worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: L. Horn

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: First put it up in the rain, then packed out in another rain storm. Easy up, stayed dry, dark, and cool. Great ventilation, even with the rainfly. 2 long poles, one short for the rainfly, up and down fast! Roomy and tall enough to stand up in. Packs easily into its own bag.
customer_reviews.author: KGA

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. Easy to set up alone. Blocks out light so sleeping in late is nice. I’ve been through rain and high wind (35)mph ish no problem. Great size for 2 people on twin air mattresses I would not recommend as a 4 person tent unless you are 4 really small people who love each other a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: A lot of room. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for two single blow-up air mattresses. Used a couple of nights with no rain. Easy to set up. Goes up easier with two people. The e-port zipper did not have a tab to unzip and looked like even if unzipped a cord could not be passed through due to it sewn shut. Was kinda looking forward to using that feature. Also, get better tent stakes. The ones included are thin and don't hold well. Except for those two things the tent works well and we'll see how it holds up on future camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walls

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use this new tent, especially with the "dark room tech" but after its first use, I'm not that excited anymore. It's a little darker than most tents, but not by much. With the black layer of fabric on the bottom half of the tent, it gets really hot inside, really quick. You have to make sure the tent is in the shade all day, or at least in the morning while you are still trying to sleep. My last Tent was a coleman instant tent, this one is much more of a pain to set up & take down. Which I would have bought another instant tent like I had.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a Coleman
customer_reviews.text: The seams near the bottom leak unless you use seam sealer. However it blocks out a lot of light which is what I like about it. Because of it's weight and bulk I wouldn't recommend it for backpacking. Buy it used and get a deal to make it worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Casey W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cracked pole
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after just a few uses one of the poles cracked straight through the entire length of a pole segment. Replacement poles look tricky to purchase too, not listing the exact sizes even on the Coleman site. The tent was great up until now, the dark room effect was nice to encourage my kids to sleep past sunrise.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Damaged tent
customer_reviews.text: After we set up the tent for the first time I had to return it. Like other people my tent was damaged. There was a hole between the thicker ground material and tent along with pin holes in the rain fly. It was easy to set up but the directions didnt explain the rain fly pole set up.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Easy, dry family tent
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this tent all week. It’s super easy to set up and fits 4 welll. We have two adult cots and 2 kids on ground. Our dog can fit great too. The o oh downside was not having light clips inside, but we rigged something to set up our lights inside. We even set the tent up in the rain and no water got it. It was a terrible rain like 5 inches. The outside was muddy but the inside dry as can be.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Deptula

customer_reviews.title: Tent arrived with broken poles
customer_reviews.text: As per the title I was disappointed with how the item arrived. This was after the first tent got lost in the mail. I tried to reach out to amazon, to no avail. I ended up going to an outdoor store near by and purchased a tent pole repair kit as well as reaching out to Coleman directly. Tent works great otherwise. Does tent stuff accurately.
customer_reviews.author: K.Joice

customer_reviews.title: Probable the best tent I have owned.
customer_reviews.text: Probable the best tent I have owned! I went with the dark teck. and am not disappointed. Sleeping in the sun till 10 + after a night of camping drinking never felt so good. Hate waking up with the sun after falling asleep min before. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: OK tent - Dark Room Feature Great.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s an okay tent. The dark room feature does work. It keeps the tent dark and cool. The material felt thinner and cheaper than usual Coleman tents. Could have just been my mind playing games. It was ok to set up. There was no set up manual or guide to follow. The stakes it comes with are typical cheap skinny metal stakes. Should get a better set incase it gets windy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Tent ripped on first use
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent for a weekend camping/fishing trip. It was very easy to set up, even alone. The tent stakes bent immediately. The rainfly ripped on this first use. It was not stormy or much more than breezy during my use. I'm hoping it was just a poorly made rainfly and they are able to replace under the warranty. I'm contacting them next.
customer_reviews.author: bch53007

customer_reviews.title: Best tent EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing! It is so dark I slept until noon while out camping!! The screen porch is perfect for shoes to keep the mud out of the tent area. Our queen air mattress fit with a little space left. It was really easy to set up and take down. I stayed cool even with the tarp on due to the porch feature! I seriously cannot say enough about thos awesome tent!
customer_reviews.author: barbie

customer_reviews.title: Honestly the best tent for festival camping
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best tent for festival camping! I took this baby to Paradiso and she performed like a charm. Stayed cool and slept in longer than anyone else in the 91° heat. I will be recommending it all summer!
customer_reviews.author: Demiismyname-o

customer_reviews.title: The tent is great. I just wish it had better instructions
customer_reviews.text: The tent is great. I just wish it had better instructions. The rain shield really threw us. Once it was set up, it survived a pretty nasty rain storm and we stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Opheim

customer_reviews.title: Barely a Difference
customer_reviews.text: Only true dark were the door, aside from that it barely made a difference compared to a regular tent. Also, the item came in just its regular box with no outside box. Item came pretty beat up. Rain fly connecting points were weak as well. Aside from that, zippers were nice.
customer_reviews.author: Be Ho

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I like the blackout feature and was able to make me sleep in longer. But even when I sprayed the tent with water proofing spray, I still found water moisture inside the tent. And that wasn’t after a rain, just from the nights dew.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rob

customer_reviews.title: Coating can have issues
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had an issue with the darkroom coating (the dark color). Spots were missing on this material that allowed the light to shine through. I returned it and the replacement one was fine. I would ask Coleman to do better QC before shipping an item like this,
customer_reviews.author: Walter Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great basic tent
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get much simpler or effective than this. Easy for two people to assemble, slightly more difficult for one to assemble but still doable. Plenty of room for two adults and one child; could probably sleep three adults comfortably maybe four but would be a little more crowded.
customer_reviews.author: James J Alsteen

customer_reviews.title: Open box isnt the same as a used product amazon
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of the tent. Stayed dry throughout heavy rain. One major complaint I have specifically has to be with Amazon and my purchase. The listing did state it was an opened box but tent stakes were not included and it was definitely used. A pillow was found in it and alot of dried grass. Shame on me for not opening the product immediately when I recieved it so I could have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Recognize

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent!
customer_reviews.text: Love my tent! Kept me dry, easy to put up and take down... maybe not the highest quality( durability is what I’d question) .. but for the price and what I need... I am one person and only will use in summers for car camping, it works great! The dark out works pretty well... as long as you have vents up and top on of course!
customer_reviews.author: Sj

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent but why the holes?
customer_reviews.text: The tent stick for the rain tarp broke after the first time we used it. Not only that but the entrance door has holes... I repeat the section that is meant to be an entranceway to prevent bugs and such as holes on the side. So of course bugs got in. Other than that... great tent. Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Raphael

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed the pole splintered 1st time setting up.
customer_reviews.text: I really love the tent but the pole broke the 1st time setting it up! I’m really mad as I bought it and it’s past the return date. It splintered right on the main pole. If the pole hadn’t broken I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat darker
customer_reviews.text: Good for car camping. The fly is too small to handle mountain storms. I liked the idea of a porch but it turns into a kiddie pool when it rains as the fly only covers the first 1/3 of it. I was surprised to find water coming in through the sides of the tent. So don't have anything touching the sides! The darkroom technology did keep it a little darker & a little cooler. The bottom of the sides are pretty sheer which lets in alot of light. It's OK. A bit pricy for what you get?
customer_reviews.author: C Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Great black out for sun and bottom protects from rain. Wish it had a few more stake loops at the bottom to help with the wind. It’s held up to super strong winds but unfortunately the rain fly ripped after 3rd use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Love the darkroom factor! I’m not a early morning person  so it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Set up is a breeze. Didn’t have inclement weather to deal with so can’t say. It was chilly, 30’s at night. I’d maybe think about getting a light reflective blanket to put over dome screens. But was totally tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: LAS

customer_reviews.title: Dark and Wet.
customer_reviews.text: Not even a heavy rain. I expected rain to puddle on the "porch", but the inside too? Disappointed to buy a new tent that can't handle a little water. (1/5) Pretty nice blocking out light, but the bottom portion let's a lot of light through. So you have a nice reduction, but not elimination of light. (4/5)
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get as dark as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: We live in the land of the midnight sun. There is no full dark here during the summer. This tent doesn't get as dark as I had hoped. However, it is darker than a normal tent. Otherwise, it is easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kendall

customer_reviews.title: The perfect tent
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this tent!!! It’s so much larger than any other 4 person tent that I’ve had. I can assemble it myself in about 5 minutes. It’s really dark inside!! I Initially set this up in my living room directly under my ceiling light. And sure enough the debt was pitch black.
customer_reviews.author: YeahWord

customer_reviews.title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Coleman products for 25 years great product and so far haven't had to contact customer service untill now. My tent came with a broken pole. Nobody answers the chat, nobody answers the phone and nobody answers the "contact us" mail. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great for Glamping!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly quick and easy set up with lots of tie downs if needed. Easily fits a queen air mattress or two twins. The front porch is really nice to take your shoes off and store extra gear you aren’t using.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you set it up in your living room!
customer_reviews.text: It’s great as long as you have winds under 5 mph. Get a gust of wind 10 mph and your poles will snap and Coleman will have you doing hand stands before they’ll RMA it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Casebolt

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping late is now possible when camping.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, easy set up, inexpensive and very roomy. The dark room feature really works with the rain fly on. With the rain fly off some light comes in from above but still fairly dark. I've used it in the rain and snow and it stays dry inside. Good old Coleman quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ollenborger

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a really good tent
customer_reviews.text: Love the tent. Easy 1 man set up if you are tall, but easier with 2 people. Large, roomy and comfortable for 2 adults with 2 young kids. Drafts good on windy days, but when the air isn’t moving, the air will not move. 5-10 min setup is very easy once you practice a few times. Nice ceiling height... I am 6’ 9” and need to bend my head when standing, but can comfortably move around in tent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: My first tent purchase. Easy to set up alone. From unboxing to set up took 20 mintues. Indoors, as a test run, without the rain fly. I'm 5' 2" and am a very inexperienced camper. Roomy inside, since I am short I can stand up fully. Haven't actually used it yet, so I can't comment on weather or rain conditions. FYI, two of the walls are mesh on the top half. Which should be great for camping in warmer weather. The rain fly is included. Very exited for my first trip
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Not as watertight as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The tent was the perfect size for me camping by myself. I was disappointed upon packing up that there was quite a bit of water along 2 sides of the tent. After I removed everything from the tent, I could see a bunch of pin holes just above the tarp floor seam and along the side walls. Life happened when I returned from my trip and returning the tent became too troublesome.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: So worth it! The darkening part of the tent works great! You can have a light on inside but dont even notice from the outside! Helps keep the sun out in the early am. Very hapoy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Blackout material is nice, but only having fly made from it was a poor decision on Coleman's part. Plus, the quality isn't great - I've had 2 of the snap things that connect to poles break in only 3 uses.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC TENT!😁
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with my new blackout tent! It's even better than I expected. My 11 yr old daughter and i put this up in 10 to 15 minutes. It went up with ease! And it was pretty gusty. It was beautiful and spacious! The rainfly is obviously what makes this tent a blackout tent, and it does restrict a little on the ventilation, but over a small payoff for the the dark effect. Great tent, I'd buy it again in a second😁
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Beneda

product_meta.title: Coleman Dome Tent for Camping
product_meta.description: Sleep in past sunrise or put the kids to bed early with the Coleman 4-Person Carlsbad Dark Room Dome Camping Tent with Screen Room. It blocks 90% of sunlight and reduces heat inside the tent (vs. a comparable Coleman tent) for more comfortable rest at any time. A separate screen room lets you watch nature unfold while keeping the bugs away. With a full floor in the screen room, you can also use it as extra sleeping space on warmer nights.
feature_bullets: DARK ROOM TECHNOLOGY: Blocks 90% of sunlight (vs. a comparable Coleman tent) so you can sleep in past sunrise
REDUCES HEAT: For a more comfortable rest anytime of day
WEATHERPROOF: Included rainfly offers extra weather protection; welded corners and inverted seams keep water from getting in; strong frame withstands 35+ mph winds
STAY CONNECTED: E-Port makes it easy to bring electrical power inside
CONVENTIONAL PITCH: Sets up in 15 minutes
BUG-FREE LOUNGING: 9 x 4 ft. full-floor screen room
DIMENSIONS: 9 x 7 ft. with 4 ft. 11 in. center height; fits 1 queen-size air bed

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
